sen.j: 大炊御門 家孝（おおいのみかど いえたか、延享4年1月25日 (旧暦)（1747年3月6日） - 寛政11年5月13日 (旧暦)（1799年6月16日））は、江戸時代中期の公卿。
sen.e: Ietaka OINOMIKADO (March 6, 1747 - June 16, 1799) was Kugyo (court noble) in the middle of the Edo period.
Ietaka OINOMIKADO (March 6, 1747 - June 16, 1799) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the middle of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: court noble→a Court Nobleに訂正しました。
sen.e: Ietaka OINOMIKADO (March 6, 1747 - June 16, 1799) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: 桃園天皇（116代）・後桜町天皇（117代）・後桃園天皇（118代）・光格天皇（119代）の四朝にわたって仕え、官位は従一位右大臣まで昇った。
sen.e: He served the Imperial Court for four reigns, Emperor Momozono (116th), Emperor Gosakuramachi (117th), Emperor Gomomozono (118th) and Emperor Kokaku (119th), and was promoted to Juichii Udaijin (Junior First Rank, minister of the right).

He served for the four sovereigns who were the 116th Emperor Momozono, the 117th Emperor Gosakuramachi, the 118th Emperor Gomomozono and the 119 Emperor Kokaku; He was promoted up to Juichii Udaijin (Junior First Rank and Minister of the right).
sen.cmt: Imperial Courtを削除しました。Reigns→sovereignsに訂正し、who wereを追加しました。訳抜けのため、promoted up to としました。Junior First Rankのあとにandを追加し、ministerの頭大文字にしました。
sen.e: He served for the four sovereigns who were the 116th Emperor Momozono, the 117th Emperor Gosakuramachi, the 118th Emperor Gomomozono and the 119 Emperor Kokaku; He was promoted up to Juichii Udaijin (Junior First Rank and Minister of the right).

sen.j: 父は内大臣大炊御門経秀。
sen.e: His father was Naidaijin (minister of the center), Tsunehide OINOMIKADO.
His father was Naidaijin (Minister of the Center), Tsunehide OINOMIKADO.
His father was Naidaijin (Minister of the Center), Tsunehide OINOMIKADO.

sen.j: 母は左大臣醍醐冬煕の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Sadaijin (minister of the right) Fuyuhiro DAIGO.
His mother was a daughter of Sadaijin (Minister of the Right) Fuyuhiro DAIGO.
His mother was a daughter of Sadaijin (Minister of the Right) Fuyuhiro DAIGO.

sen.j: 室は右大臣三条季晴の娘、継室に対馬府中藩主宗義蕃の娘。
sen.e: His wife was a daughter of Udaijin (minister of the right) Sueharu SANJO, while his second wife was a daughter of Yoshishige SO, the lord of the Tsushima Fuchu domain.
His legitimate wife was a daughter of Udaijin (Minister of the Right) Sueharu SANJO; his second wife was a daughter of Yoshishige SO who was the lord of the Tsushima Fuchu domain.
sen.cmt: his wifeにlegitimateを追加しました。Minister頭大文字にしました。Andを削除し;としwho wasを追加しました。
sen.e: His legitimate wife was a daughter of Udaijin (Minister of the Right) Sueharu SANJO; his second wife was a daughter of Yoshishige SO who was the lord of the Tsushima Fuchu domain.

sen.j: 子に大炊御門経久、娘に対馬府中藩主宗義功 (富寿)室、小浜藩主酒井忠貫室がいる。
sen.e: He had a son, Tunehisa OINOMIKADO and daughters, a wife of Yoshikatsu SO (富寿) the lord of Tsushima Fuchu domain and a wife of Tadatsura SAKAI, the lord of Obama domain.

He had several children including, a son, Tunehisa OINOMIKADO and some daughters; One was the wife of Yoshikatsu SO (富寿) who was the lord of Tsushima Fuchu domain, and another was the wife of Tadatsura SAKAI who was the lord of Obama domain.
sen.cmt: several children including, someを追加しました。One, anotherを追加しました。The lordの前にｗho wasを追加しました。
sen.e: He had several children including, a son, Tunehisa OINOMIKADO and some daughters; One was the wife of Yoshikatsu SO (富寿) who was the lord of Tsushima Fuchu domain, and another was the wife of Tadatsura SAKAI who was the lord of Obama domain.

sen.j: 寛延元年（1748年）に叙爵してから、清華家当主として速いスピードで昇進した。
sen.e: After he was conferred a peerage in 1748, he was quickly promoted as the family head of the Seiga family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After he was conferred a peerage in 1748, being the head of the Seiga family, he was successfully promoted in the Imperial Court in a short period.
sen.cmt: 誤訳です。he was quickly promoted as the family head of the Seiga familyの部分を訂正しました。
sen.e: After he was conferred a peerage in 1748, being the head of the Seiga family, he was successfully promoted in the Imperial Court in a short period.

sen.j: 左近衛権少将・右近衛権中将をへて、宝暦6年（1756年）に従三位に達し公卿に列する。
sen.e: He served as Sakone gon no shosho and Ukone no Gon no chujo (Provisional Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and was promoted to Jusanmi in 1756 and ranked with Kugyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He served as "Sakone gon no shosho"(Provisional Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) and "Ukone no Gon no chujo" (Provisional Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1756, which gavem him the title Kugyo.
sen.cmt: 定訳より、Sakone gon no shosho, Jusanmiの訳を追加しました。Was ranked withを which gave him the titleに訂正しました。
sen.e: He served as "Sakone gon no shosho"(Provisional Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) and "Ukone no Gon no chujo" (Provisional Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1756, which gavem him the title Kugyo.

sen.j: その後も権中納言・権大納言・踏歌節会外弁を歴任し、天明元年（1781年）より右近衛大将・右馬寮御監となるも、天明2年（1782年）からは右近衛大将を辞職して、皇太后近衛維子の皇太后宮権大夫に転じた。
sen.e: After he successively held various posts such as Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice councilor of state), Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) and Toka no sechie Geben (a kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie (Imperial Court Ceremony)), he took the posts of Ukone no daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and Umaryo gogen (Inspector of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses) in 1781, however, he resigned the post of Ukone no daisho and turned to Kotaigogu gon no daibu (Provisional Master of the Empress Dowager's Household) to the Empress Dowager, Koreko KONOE since 1782.

He successively held different positions such as "Gon Chunagon" (Provisional Vice Councilor of State), "Gon Dainagon" (Provisional Major Counselor) and "Toka no Sechie Geben" (Kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at "Toka no sechie" [Imperial Court Ceremony]); He took the positions of "Ukone no daisho" (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and "Umaryo gogen" (Inspector of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses) in 178; However, he resigned the position of Ukone no daisho and became "Kotaigogu gon no daibu" (Provisional Master of the Empress Dowager's Household) to the Empress Dowager, Koreko KONOE since 1782.
sen.cmt: Afterを削除し、各文を;でつなぎました。Various→differentに訂正しました。各役職に""を追加し、()内のカッコを[]に訂正しました。Post→positionに訂正しました。Turned toをbecameしました。
sen.e: He successively held different positions such as "Gon Chunagon" (Provisional Vice Councilor of State), "Gon Dainagon" (Provisional Major Counselor) and "Toka no Sechie Geben" (Kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at "Toka no sechie" [Imperial Court Ceremony]); He took the positions of "Ukone no daisho" (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and "Umaryo gogen" (Inspector of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses) in 178; However, he resigned the position of Ukone no daisho and became "Kotaigogu gon no daibu" (Provisional Master of the Empress Dowager's Household) to the Empress Dowager, Koreko KONOE since 1782.

sen.j: しかし翌年には維子皇太后が崩御したため、職を辞している。
sen.e: Since the Empress Dowager, Koreko KONOE died next year, he resigned the post.
Since the Empress Dowager, Koreko KONOE died the next year, he resigned the position.
sen.cmt: post→positionに訂正しました。theを追加しました。
sen.e: Since the Empress Dowager, Koreko KONOE died the next year, he resigned the position.

sen.j: 天明7年（1787年）に内大臣となり、天明8年（1788年）には踏歌節会内弁をつとめた。
sen.e: In 1787, he became Naidaijin (minister of the center) and in 1788, he took the post of Toka no sechie Naiben (a kugyo who supervised inside Jomei gate at Toka no sechie (Imperial Court ceremony)).
In 1787, he became Naidaijin (Minister of the Center); In 1788, he took the position of "Toka no sechie Naiben" (Kugyo who supervised inside Jomei gate at Toka no sechie [Imperial Court ceremony]).
sen.cmt: post→positionに訂正しました。Andをとり、;でつなぎました。()内括弧を[]に訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1787, he became Naidaijin (Minister of the Center); In 1788, he took the position of "Toka no sechie Naiben" (Kugyo who supervised inside Jomei gate at Toka no sechie [Imperial Court ceremony]).

sen.j: 寛政元年（1789年）に内大臣を辞職し、従一位を授与された。
sen.e: In 1789, he resigned the post of Naidaijin, and was conferred Juichii (Junior First Rank).
In 1789, after he resigned Naidaijin, he was conferred Juichii (Junior First Rank).
sen.cmt: the post ofを削除しました。Afterを追加し、andを削除しました。
sen.e: In 1789, after he resigned Naidaijin, he was conferred Juichii (Junior First Rank).

sen.j: 寛政4年（1793年）には再度内大臣に任じられたが、すぐに辞職している。
sen.e: In 1793, he was appointed as Naidaijin again, however, he resigned the post shortly after that,
In 1793, although he was appointed Naidaijin again, he resigned the position shortly after that.
sen.cmt: howeverをとり、文頭にalthoughを追加しました。Asを削除しました。Post→positionに訂正しました。文末の,（カンマ）を.（ピリオド）に訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1793, although he was appointed Naidaijin again, he resigned the position shortly after that.

sen.j: 寛政8年（1796年）には右大臣となったが、同年のうちに辞職した。
sen.e: In 1796, although he became Udaijin (minister of the right), he resigned the post within the same year.
In 1796, although he became Udaijin (Minister of the Right), he resigned the position within the same year.
sen.cmt: minister of the rightを頭大文字にしました。Post→positionに訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1796, although he became Udaijin (Minister of the Right), he resigned the position within the same year.
